duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage all vehicle services, equipment, service associates and service instruction to increase capacity utilization through efficient/effective processing of tire and service demand.
Lead and supervise a team of service associates, planning and scheduling their duties, and following up on completion of assignments.
Analyze market trends, customer behavior, and competitor activity to identify growth opportunities and refine strategies.
Handle customer complaints, conduct vehicle service, and grow profit through service or tire recommendations as needed by the customer.
Plan, arrange, and direct participation in industry events, conferences, and trade shows to showcase services and network with potential clients.
Measure and report on the performance of the service department, using data-driven insights to continuously improve strategies.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or equivalent, 5 years of automotive technical experience with 2 years of engine performance/driveability experience. ASE Certified in (A4) Suspension & Steering, (A5) Brakes, (A6) Electrical/Electronics Systems, (A7) Heating & Air Conditioning, (A8) Engine Performance.
